contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox comics creator <!-- | name = Ann Telnaes --> | image = | birth_name = Ann Carolyn Telnaes | birth_date = 1960 | birth_place = [[Stockholm, Sweden]] | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = American | area = Editorial cartoonist | cartoonist = | write = | art = | pencil = | ink = | edit = | publish = | letter = | color = | alias = | signature = <!-- very optional --> | notable works = | awards = | website = | subcat = American }} '''Ann Carolyn Telnaes''' (born 1960 in [[Stockholm, Sweden|Stockholm]], [[Sweden]]) is an [[editorial cartoonist]]. Unlike many editorial cartoonists, Telnaes does not draw for any one set newspaper, and her cartoons are instead [[print syndication|syndicated]] across the [[United States]]. In 2001, she became the second woman cartoonist to win the [[Pulitzer Prize]] for [[editorial cartoon]]ing.<ref>{{cite web| publisher=Library of Congress| title=Pulitzer-prize winning cartoons (Humor's Edge: Cartoons by Ann Telnaes, Library of Congress)| url=http://www.loc.gov/exhibits/telnaes/telnaes-pulitzer.html| date=2004-06-22| accessdate=2007-06-21| archiveurl= http://web.archive.org/web/20070628231110/http://www.loc.gov/exhibits/telnaes/telnaes-pulitzer.html| archivedate= 28 June 2007 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref> She studied with the Character Animation program at [[California Institute of the Arts]].<ref>{{cite web| publisher=Population Media Center| title=PMC 2005 Contest| url=http://www.populationmedia.org/cartooncontest/2005/winnersbios.html| year=2004| accessdate=2007-06-21 |archiveurl = http://web.archive.org/web/20071009040433/http://www.populationmedia.org/cartooncontest/2005/winnersbios.html <!-- Bot retrieved archive --> |archivedate = 2007-10-09}}</ref> Her cartoons tend to be quite [[Modern liberalism in the United States|liberal]] in tone and have a special focus on women's issues, such as [[burka]]s, [[third world]] pregnancy and [[abortion]] rights. A former animator at [[Disney]], her cartoons are easily recognizable for their fluid lines and bright (often spot) colors. Her animations are featured on ''[[The Washington Post]]'''s website. ==Filmography== The Brave Little Toaster, 1987- layout artist and animator The Chipmunk Adventure, 1987- inbetweener ==References== <references/> ==External links== {{Portal|Biography}} *[http://www.anntelnaes.com/ ''Ann Telnaes''-official site] *[http://www.loc.gov/exhibits/telnaes/ Library of Congress, Humor's Edge: Cartoons by Ann Telnaes] *[http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-srv/opinions/cartoonsandvideos/telnaes/telnaes_main.html?nid=roll_telnaes Ann Telnaes animations at The Washington Post.] {{PulitzerPrize EditorialCartooning 2001â€“2025}} {{Authority control|VIAF=70775423}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Telnaes, Ann | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION =Cartoonist | DATE OF BIRTH =1960 | PLACE OF BIRTH =[[Stockholm, Sweden]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Telnaes, Ann}} [[Category:American animators]] [[Category:American editorial cartoonists]] [[Category:Pulitzer Prize for Editorial Cartooning winners]] [[Category:1960 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Women animators]] {{US-cartoonist-stub}}
